com.amplifyframework.rx

Interface RxDataStoreCategoryBehavior


  • public interface RxDataStoreCategoryBehavior
    An Rx-idiomatic expression of the behaviors in DataStoreCategoryBehavior.

    • Method Summary

      Resets the underlying DataStore to its pre-initialized state such that no data remains on the local device.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A Completable which completes on success, emits error on error

        Parameters:
        item - An item to save
        predicate - Predicate condition to apply for conditional write

      • query

        <T extends Model> <any> query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested Java class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        Returns:
        An observable stream of 0..n query results, if available. The Observable will then terminate either either a completion or error.

      • query

        <T extends Model> <any> query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                              QueryPredicate predicate)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested Java class that fulfills the predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        predicate - Predicate condition to apply to query
        Returns:
        An observable stream of 0..n query results, if available. The Observable will then terminate either either a completion or error.

      • query

        <T extends Model> <any> query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                              QueryOptions options)
        Query the DataStore to find items of the requested Java class, using the provided QueryOptions. The query options include support for filtering, paging and sorting.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Class of items that will be queried
        options - Filtering, paging, and sorting options
        Returns:
        An observable stream of 0..n query results, if available. The Observable will then terminate either either a completion or error.

      • observe

        <any> observe()
        Observe all changes to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.
        Returns:
        An observable stream of DataStoreItemChanges, one for each and every change that occurs to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.

      • observe

        <T extends Model> <any> observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass)
        Observe changes to a certain type of item(s) in the DataStore.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item(s) to observe
        Returns:
        An observable stream of DataStoreItemChanges, that will emit a new DataStoreItemChange whenever there there are changes to any item of the requested item class.

      • observe

        <T extends Model> <any> observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                java.lang.String uniqueId)
        Observe changes to a specific item, identified by its class and unique ID.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of item being observed
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item being observed
        uniqueId - The unique ID of the item being observed
        Returns:
        A stream of DataStoreItemChange events, specific to a single item which was uniquely identified by the provided class and unique id. Note that this stream may emit a non-trivial number of events, in case the selected item is updated many times.

      • observe

        <T extends Model> <any> observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                QueryPredicate selectionCriteria)
        Observe a collection of item(s) that have a specified class type, and that match additional criteria, specified by a fluent chain of selection operators.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of item(s) to observe
        selectionCriteria - Additional criteria which will be considered when identifying which items in the DataStore should be observed for changes.
        Returns:
        An observable stream of DataStoreItemChanges, emitted for items that are of the requested class, and that match the provided selection criteria

      • start

        Completable start()
        Starts the DataStore. This only needs to be called if you wish to start eagerly. If you don't call it, it will be called automatically prior to executing any other operations (#query, #save, #delete, #observe).
        Returns:
        A Completable which emits success after DataStore is initialized. This does not block until subscriptions and sync are complete. To block until sync and subscriptions are complete, use Amplify.Hub.subscribe to listen for the DataStoreChannelEventName.READY event on HubChannel.DATASTORE.

      • stop

        Completable stop()
        Stops the underlying DataStore, resetting the plugin to the initialized state.
        Returns:
        A Completable which emits success upon successful stop of DataStore, emits an error, otherwise

      • clear

        Completable clear()
        Resets the underlying DataStore to its pre-initialized state such that no data remains on the local device. Every implementation of this behavior may have its own interpretation of what clear means. This is meant to be a destructive operation that allows for safe disposal of data stored locally.
        Returns:
        A Completable which emits success upon successful clear of DataStore, emits an error, otherwise
